description.narrative: The Development Objectives of the proposed operation are to improve the quality and efficiency of training institutions and createan enabling environment for a more market-driven Technical and Vocational Education Training System.

participating-org.narrative: Directorate of Project Education and Training

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Counterpart Funding | Description :The Counterpart Funds shall be disbursed quarterly, no later than March 31,June 30, September 30 and December 31 of the corresponding calendar year, on the basis of the Annual Work Plan and Budget |Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Financial Statements and INAP-FTP#s financial statements | Description :The audited Financial Statements foreach The audit report shall be furnished to the Association not later than six months after the end of such period. | Frequency:Yearly
Finance Agreement :Implementation Manual and the Manual of Procedures of FAP-FTP | Description :update the Project ImplementationManual and the Manual of Procedures of FAP- | Due Date :13-Sep-2011

Finance Agreement :Legal Matter | Description :Subsidiary Agreement has been duly authorized or ratified by the Recipient andINAP-FTP and is legally binding upon the Recipient and INAP-FTP in accordance with its terms. | Due Date :10-Sep-2011

Finance Agreement :Schedule 1.1.a | Description :No later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall haverecruited on the basis of terms of reference, qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association: An environmental andsocial safeguard specialist and procurement experts tosupport DPEF. | Due Date :31-Jul-2014

Finance Agreement :Section 1.B.3 | Description :The Recipient and INAP-FTP shall execute an amendment, acceptable to IDA, to theSubsidiary Agreement in order to provide for the making of the proceeds of the Financing allocated from time to time to Categories1 and 2 of the Disbursement Table set in Section IV.A.2 of this Schedule available by the Recipient to INAP-FTP. All otherprovisions of the Subsidiary Agreement remain unchanged | Due Date :31-Jul-2014

Finance Agreement :Section I.G. | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that the funds deposited into such account in accordancewith the provisions of subparagraph (b) are used for their intended purposes. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Section I.G. | Description :The Recipient shall establish or designate, and maintain throughout Projectimplementation, a second account in Ouguiyas, in a commercial bank acceptable to the Association, on terms and conditionssatisfactory to the Association; | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Section I.G. | Description :The Recipient shall provide counterpart funds in the amount of an amount no lessthan US$800,000. These Additional Counterpart Funds shall be disbursed quarterly, no later than March 31, June 30, September 30 andDecember 31 of the corresponding calendar year, onthe basis of the Annual Work Plan and Budget. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section I.G. | Description :The Recipient shall starting from 2015, deposit into such account an aggregateamount equivalent to the amount of Operating Costs and 25% of the Sub-grants under Part 1.2(c) of the Project not financed from thefunds of the Original Financing, as showed in the Annual Work Plan and Budget for the corresponding calendar year, as AdditionalCounterpart Funds | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section I.G. | Description :The first disbursement of the Counterpart Funds shall be in an amount equivalent toone hundred thousand Dollars ($100,000) and shall be made no later than two (2) months after the Effective Date. | Due Date:31-Aug-2014
Finance Agreement :Strengthening the Financial management system | Description :INAP-FTP to recruit a financial managementspecialist | Due Date :13-Sep-2011
Finance Agreement :update the Project the financial management software in DPEF | Description :Acquisition of a management softwarein DPEF and INAP/FTP | Due Date :13-Sep-2011

title.narrative: Training programs certified to meet international standards
TVET institutions with an agreed PBC
TVET institutions providing a detailed report on time with information on agreed performance indicators
Number of TVET institutions conducting tracer studies
Share of students enrolled in new private TVET training providers
Youth in short term training programs provided by both NGOs and public/private training institutions
Youth enrolled in short term training programs finding employment in field related to training within 6 months of completion of training/apprenticeship(Quality
Student graduating from TVET institution supported by the project
Increase in enrollment in participating TVET institutions (annually)
Share of government contribution to FAP-FTP’s budget (%)
Resources generated from services provided by TVET institutions as part of recurrent budget
Student unit cost in apprenticeship and training programs
Reduced Drop-out rate in participating TVET institutions(Quality)
Regulatory framework provides legal protection and status to private sector training institutions (Enabling Environment)
MDEFPNT produces an annual statistical yearbook with updated information on key TVET indicators
Percentage of Health facilities that have case definition/guidelines for Ebola
Establishment of a functioning rapid-response team (Ebola prevention)
Presence of an isolation unit for Ebola case investigation and management
